result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry Seville Bufford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay costs for supervision fees as determined by Dept. of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Court waived all other cost due to under hardship on the defendant.

- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- Court lifted the No Contact Order.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry Seville Bufford

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terry Seville Bufford in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
As to Count 1:

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.  Additional Statement made by Shanice W.

The court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 2 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-Court lifted the no contact order.
-Pay cost for supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Court waived all other cost due to undue hardship on the defendant.
Defense in court requesting modification of the No Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Judge Protasiewicz has agreed to take the defendant's plea.
Case transferred forthwith to Judge Protasiewicz for a plea hearing.

The defendant is requesting a different attorney.  Court denied his request.  Case calendared for jury trial in Branch 36.
  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court. Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant did not appear today but Attorney Dluzak informed the court that he is in the hospital.

If defendant fails to appear on the next court date, the court will lift the stay and issue the bench warrant on that day.
Case adjourned for status in Branch 36.

  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry Seville Bufford in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Sarra Kiaie.  
cab
The defendant appeared later in the morning.
The court ordered the bench warrant withdrawn and signature bond reinstated.  
Case calendared for a plea and sentencing in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.

Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.  The Court ordered that the defendant be REMANDED to the commisioner upon return on the bench warrant

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with BSW (8/8/11) and TLB (4/13/14).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Terry Seville Bufford in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Terry Seville Bufford in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
